Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tacrolimus Plus Prednisone in CIDP Management

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study was conducted at Xuanwu Hospital, Capital Medical University, from April 2019 to June 2023.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults diagnosed with CIDP according to the 2021 EAN/PNS guidelines, with an INCAT disability score ≥2.

Intervention.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of tacrolimus plus prednisone (T&P) compared to prednisone monotherapy (PM) in CIDP maintenance treatment.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of tacrolimus plus prednisone (T&P) compared to prednisone monotherapy (PM) in CIDP maintenance treatment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the response rate, defined as a ≥1-point improvement in INCAT score at 3, 6, and 12 months.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 74 screened patients, 34 were included (16 T&P, 18 PM).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 74 screened patients, 34 were included (16 T&P, 18 PM).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The T&P group demonstrated significantly higher response rates at 3 and 6 months compared to PM, though this difference attenuated by 12 months.

Harms.evidence: Both groups showed comparable safety profiles, with no serious adverse reactions reported.
